p: In the early stages of the disease, the total number of leukocytes in peripheral blood is normal or decreased, the lymphocyte count is decreased, and some patients show increases in liver enzymes, muscle enzymes, and myoglobin. The C-reactive protein (CRP) and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) are increased in most patients, and procalcitonin is normal. In severe cases, D-dimer increases, and peripheral blood lymphocytes decrease progressively. Coronavirus nucleic acid can be detected in the throat, sputum, lower respiratory tract secretions, blood and tool.
